Files s=
ection of this group.  Sidhant did essentially what you are 
suggesting (wi=
th some additional details) with NEAT and did obtain 
promising results.  (=
Sidhant posted about his work right before you 
posted your question)

>

and=

techniqu=
es.

>=
 authors used neural networks to try to perform better than 
classical
> te=
chniques but the results seemed to be mitigated (ref : Christian 
L.
> Duni=
s and Mark Williams, Modeling and Trading the EUR/USD Exchange
> Rate: Do N=
eural Network Models Perform Better ?).
> 
> Basically, I suppose that NEAT=
 could be applied with success to 
this
> kind of supervised learning, star=
ting from a lot of historic data 
and
> then using backpropagation to deter=
mine the weights of the network.

ure of the networks produced 
by
> NEAT, each network will have to be train=
ed using a training data 
set
> (with backpropagation technique) and then v=
alidated using the
> validating data set, thus providing a fitness measure.=
 The networks

on.

xibility
